descript.abstract: U.S. Recreational Areas represents point locations in the United States for common recreational landmarks including golf courses (facilities for play and instruction), beaches, amusement parks (includes arcades), and park and recreation areas.
descript.purpose: U.S. Recreational Areas provides the locations of common recreational landmarks including golf courses, beaches, amusement parks, and park and recreation areas. Each recreational area is named and shows the codes of the state and county it resides in.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

citeinfo.title: Points of Interest, Administrative Area Order 8

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted the Points of Interest dataset from TomTom MultiNet North America. Selected the recreational area features. Removed all fields except FEATTYP and NAME. Renamed field FEATTYP to MNFC. Added field FEATTYPE and copied its values from MultiNet FEATTYP descriptions. Added field TEXTLENGTH and calculated its values to the length of the text in the NAME field. Added field STCTYFIPS and coded it by overlaying on Administrative Area Order 8 (County or equivalent area) dataset from TomTom MultiNet North America.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the locations in the United States for common recreational landmarks including golf courses (facilities for play and instruction); beaches; amusement parks (includes arcades); and park and recreation areas comprising of battlefields, historic sites and historical parks, memorials, forests, parks, parkways, lakeshores, seashores, picnic areas, fairgrounds, natural attractions, boat launches, river scenic areas, fishing and hunting areas, wilderness areas, preserves, winter sports areas, and ski areas.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state or territory in which the recreational area is located combined with the FIPS code (three-digit number) for the county (or equivalent area) in which the recreational area is located.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas; INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The official name of the recreational area.
The feature type description of the recreational area.
The MultiNet feature type code of the recreational area.
The length of the text in the NAME field.

Outside the United States, direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0.

distinfo.distliab: See access and use constraints information.

digtinfo.formcont: To use this data requires software that works with FGDB files.

stdorder.ordering: Data and Maps is available only as part of ArcGIS® software.
